question:
What is the reason that Australia is very dry continent and only Antarctica receives less rainfall than Australia?
  1. The landmass in Australia has low elevation
  2. Australiaâ€™s West Coast is touched by warm ocean currents
  3. Australia is dominated by low pressure systems
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation:
The reasons are as follows:
  • Cold ocean currents off the west coast
  • Low elevation of landforms
  • Dominance of high-pressure systems
  • Shape of the landmass
